bioghist.p: The Ludlow family is allied to the Smith family through the marriage of Gertrude Gouverneur Clemson to Lewis Lawrence Smith. Gabriel Ludlow (1663-1736) emigrated from England to New York in 1694. Three years after his arrival, he married Sarah Hanmer. Thomas Ludlow, their son, married Catharine Leroux; their daughter was Sarah Frances (1744-1823). Abraham Ogden (1743-1798) married Sarah Frances Ludlow (1744-1823). Their son, Issac (1784-1867) married Sarah Ogden Meredith (1803-1878) in 1828. Issac and Sarah Ludlow's daughter, Sarah Frances Ogden (1833-[1910]), married Rev. Thomas Green Clemson (1833-1888). Their daughter, Gertrude Gouverneur Clemson (1867-1947) married Lewis Lawrence Smith (1864-1931) in 1892. Their son, Lawrence M.C. Smith, was the husband of Eleanor Houston Smith.

scopecontent.p: The Ludlow family papers contain a reprint from the New York Genealogical and Biographical Record entitled "Gabriel Ludlow and His Descendants," which gives extensive genealogical and historical information about the family in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. The series also contains clippings about and an engraving of Ludlow Castle (1813), i.e., Stokesay Castle in South Shropshire, England, which was the family residence for ten generations.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
